“Anyway you go, we will sure follow”it is our faith and values towards the EASTERN LONG LIONS Football Team ever since the EASTERN 12 was established. Judging from recent social phenomenon and unforeseeable circumstances concerning the travel across the border to China, and no guarantee for the absolute safe from neither organizer nor participating clubs, the EASTERN 12 has decided, reluctantly, NOT to participate the week 2 Hong Kong Premier League game, R&F vs Eastern Long Lions, held in the Yanzigang Stadium, Guangzhou on the 14th of September 2019.

We, the EASTERN 12, feel deeply sorry towards our team not to participate and show our support. Yet, securing every EASTERN 12 member safe is our responsibility.

Meanwhile, we would like to raise some concerns
1.) Is it still a responsible way to decide the home venue in Guangzhou, even there is no guarantee for the team players, staff and coaches, and the supporting fans?
2.) What is the rational to decide the home venue is outside Hong Kong territory for the Hong Kong Premier League?

Wish the team all the best.
COME ON EASTERN
2nd September 2019

2009 presidential election protests

During the final game of the 2010 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against South Korea in Seoul on 17 June 2009, seven members of the team, Javad Nekounam, Ali Karimi, Hossein Kaebi, Masoud Shojaei, Mohammad Nosrati, Vahid Hashemian, and captain Mehdi Mahdavikia wore green wristbands in support of the Iranian Green Movement during the 2009 Iranian election protests. Initial rumors and false reports were that all seven players were banned for life by the Iranian Football Federation, however, state-run media claimed that all seven had "retired".On 24 June 2009, FIFA wrote to Iran's Football Federation asking for clarification on the situation. The Iranian Football Federation replied that no disciplinary action has been taken against any player.As of 2014 FIFA World Cup qualification, many of the above players have played again for the national team, notably Javad Nekounam, Masoud Shojaei, Mehdi Mahdavikia, and Ali Karimi.
